・東京の冬は夏と違って湿度が低い.　Unlike the summers, Tokyo winters are low in humidity.

・あなたは私と違うことを考えている.　You and I are not thinking about the same thing. ｜ We are not on the same wavelength.

・国にはそれぞれ違った伝統がある.　Different nations all have their own distinct traditions.
・何度計算しても答えが違う.　However many times I do the ┏calculation, I ┏always get a different result [never get the same answer].

・知っていることと教えることは違う.　Knowing something is not the same as being able to teach it.
・君と僕とでは立場が違う.　You and I are not in the same ┏position [boat].
・私と妹は父親が違う.　My (younger) sister and I have different fathers.
・われわれは帰る方向が違う.　Our routes home lie in different directions.
・彼も私もヒデキという名だが漢字が違う.　He and I are both "Hideki" but we write our names with different characters.
・イヌとネコは違う動物だ.　Dogs and cats are different animals.
・私の考えは君とは違う.　My ┏view [opinion] differs from yours.
・このことわざは今は違った意味に解釈されている.　Nowadays this proverb is given a different interpretation.
・今度は違う場所で会おう.　Let's meet somewhere ┏different [else] next time.

・あれは木村さんとは違う人だ.　That's not Mr. Kimura. It's someone else.
・このポロシャツ, カタログと違うじゃないか.　Isn't this polo shirt different from the one in the catalogue?
・予定とは違う飛行機で来た.　I came on a different flight from the one I had booked.
・これはきのうと違う道だ.　This isn't the same road as we were on yesterday.
・10 年前とは違う分野を専攻している.　I am not specializing in the same field as I was ten years ago.
・演奏法を変えると違った音が出る.　If you perform the piece differently the sound takes on a different quality.
・彼はいくつも違う筆名を持っている.　He has a number of different pen names.
・このペン, 君のと違う?　Isn't this your pen? ｜ Isn't this pen yours?

・このワインは想像していた味と違う.　This wine tastes different from how I imagined.

►計算の答えが違う　the answer to this sum is ┏wrong [incorrect]
・順番が違う　the order is wrong; they are in the wrong order.
►名簿の名前が違っている.　There is a mistake in my name on the ┏list [register]. ｜ I am ┏down [listed] under the wrong name.

1 〔体力・筋力〕 (physical) strength; energy; force; power; 〔精力〕 energy; vitality; vigor; verve; 〔元気〕 heart; courage; spirit; *《俗》 pep; ginger; 〔勢い・迫力〕 force; power; stress; emphasis.
►力だけで　by sheer ┏strength [force]; by [with] brute force; with naked force
・彼らは力だけで押してきた.　They overcame us with sheer force.
・力なく　＝力無げに (⇒ちからなげ)
・彼は力なくベッドに横たわっていた.　He lay ┏feeble [weak] on the bed.
►腕の力がある　be physically strong
・彼は非常に力がある.　He is immensely strong. ｜ He is as strong as a horse.
・力がない　be weak; lack strength; have no energy; be in low spirits; be dejected; be dispirited
・力が増す[減る]　gain [diminish] in strength; become [get] stronger [weaker]
・力が抜ける　one's strength ebbs away; 〈人が主語〉 be exhausted; be spent; be relaxed; 〔力みがなくなる〕 stop ┏straining [trying so hard]; take it easier; 〔元気がなくなる〕 be enervated; lose one's energy; be [feel] discouraged; lose heart
・ついに力が尽きた.　At last his strength ┏gave out [failed him].
・力がつく　become [get] stronger; gain strength [＝ちからづく]
・病人はだんだん力がついてきた.　The sick person is gradually ┏getting stronger [gaining strength].
・力がわいてくる　be [feel] reinvigorated
・彼の言い方には力がない.　His remarks lack force.
・彼の筆には力がある.　He has a powerful pen.
►力に任せて　with all one's ┏strength [might]; by ┏brute [sheer] force
・力に任せて引っ張る　pull with all one's strength.
►力のない[弱い]　weak; having ┏no [little] strength [power, influence]
・力のない声で　in a weak voice
・力のない絵　a lifeless picture
・力のある[強い]　strong; powerful
・力のある文章　a powerful piece of writing; a forceful style
・力のある演説　a ┏powerful [forceful] speech
・力の続く限り　while [as long as] one's strength lasts.
►力を比べる　compare one's strength 《with…》
・力を試す　test one's strength 《against…》
・力を出す　exert [put out, 《文》 put forth] all one's strength; put one's strength into sth
・力をつける　build up one's strength; get stronger
・力を集中する　muster one's strength; concentrate [focus] one's ┏energy [strength] on…
・力を失う　lose 《all》 one's strength
・力を増してくる　build up one's strength
・力を回復する　regain [renew] one's strength
・力を奮い起こす　summon up one's strength; summon up the ┏ strength [energy] 《to do》
・満身の力を両腕に込める　put all one's strength into one's arms
・最後の力をふりしぼる　drain [use up] the last of one's strength [one's last ounce of strength]
・力を入れた[込めた]　forceful; emphatic
・力を入れて[込めて]　forcefully; emphatically; with emphasis
・力を入れて[込めて]言う　speak forcefully; lay stress on one's words; 〔強調する〕 stress; accentuate; emphasize
・うんと力を入れて　making a great effort; putting one's back into 《the task》
・もっと力を入れて引っ張って.　Pull harder! ｜ Put your back into it!
・肩の力を抜く　⇒かた３ 1
・腕の力を緩める　relax (the tension in) one's arms.
・…に力を得る　be encouraged by…; be heartened by…; be cheered up by…
・彼女は周囲の励ましに力を得て研究を続けた.　Heartened by the encouragement of those around her, she went on with her research.
・力を落とす　be ┏dejected [dispirited]; be ┏disheartened [discouraged]; be disappointed; be crestfallen; be despondent; lose heart
・度重なる失敗に力を落とす　be discouraged by repeated failures
・栄養ドリンクを飲んで力をつける　fortify oneself by drinking a tonic
・力を向ける　direct one's energies 《to…》
・力を注ぐ　throw one's energy 《into…》
・力を出し切る　exhaust [burn up all] one's energy 《doing…》; 《work》 to the limits of one's capacity
・力を出させる　tax one's ┏strength [energies]
・生きる力をなくす　lose the ┏strength [energy] to go on living; lose the will to live
・彼は奥さんを亡くしてひどく力を落としている.　He is terribly downcast after losing his wife.
・その報告に力を得た.　The report was ┏reassuring [encouraging].
・もっと力を入れて歌いなさい.　Sing with more life.
►力は五分五分だ.　They equal us in strength.
・彼は非常に衰弱して歩く力もなかった.　He was so weak that he had not the strength to walk.
2 【物】 〔物理的な〕 force; power; energy.
►熱の力　heat energy; caloric energy
・蒸気の力　steam power

・磁石の力　magnetic virtue
・合成された力　＝ごうりょく 1.
►力が働く　a force operates
・この爆弾は一瞬で町全体を破壊する力がある.　This bomb is powerful enough to destroy a whole town in an instant.
・この一点に力がかかっている.　The force is applied to this one point.
►波の力で岩が浸食された.　The rock was eroded by wave action.
►力の場　a force field
・力の合成　composition of forces
・力の成分　a component of (a) force
・力の釣り合い　equilibrium of forces
・力の定数　〔力と変形の比〕 a force constant
・力の分解　decomposition of (a) force
・力のモーメント　the moment of (a) force.
►力を伝える　【機】 transmit force 《to the steering wheel》.

・神の力　divine power; divine agency.
►この水晶は不思議な力を秘めている.　This crystal has mysterious powers.

・世論の力　the force of public opinion

►…の力で　by ┏dint [force] of…

・親の力で　through the influence of one's parents
・政府の力で　by government(al) authority
・警察の力で取り締まる　control sth by police authority.
►力に屈する　submit [bow] to authority
・力には力で対抗するほかはない.　Force has to be countered with force.
►力の政治　power politics
・力の政策　a policy of force
・力のある　powerful; influential; weighty; forceful
・力の均衡　a balance of power; a power balance.
►力を振るう　exercise authority; wield power 《over…》; demonstrate one's abilities
・力を制するに力をもってする　use power to curb power.
5 〔努力・骨折り〕 effort(s); labor; exertion(s); energy.
►自分の力で　by one's own efforts.
►力の限りを尽くした.　No effort has been spared.
►力を合わせる　cooperate; unite one's efforts; join forces 《with…》; 《口》 join hands 《with…》
・力を合わせて　in cooperation 《with…》; uniting one's efforts
・力を尽くす　make (strong) efforts 《to…》; exert oneself
・…に力を入れる　take great interest in…; pay particular [special] attention to…
・子供の教育に力を入れる　pay special attention to the education of one's children
・僕らの学校は運動競技に大いに力を入れている.　Our school lays great stress on sports.
・…の方に力を用いる　put [lay, place] emphasis on…
・彼は地域発展のために大いに力を尽くした.　He has made strong efforts to promote regional development.
・筆者はその本にずいぶん力を入れた.　The author put a lot of effort into that work.
6 〔効力・効果〕 efficacy; effectiveness; effect; efficiency; 〔貢献・助力・尽力〕 assistance; aid; help; support; good offices; services.
►…にあずかって力がある　contribute to…; do much for…; have a share in doing
・日本の今日の隆盛は外国文化の研究にあずかって大いに力がある.　The study of foreign cultures has contributed greatly to Japan's current prosperity.
►…の力で　with the ┏aid [help] of…; through sb's aid
・科学の力で　through science
・薬の力で痛みをおさえている.　Drugs help to alleviate the pain.
►力にする　rely [depend, count] on…; *figure on…
・力になる　help; assist; support; give ┏assistance [aid] to…; lend [extend] sb a helping hand; be helpful to…; stand by sb
・杖を力に歩く　walk with the ┏aid [help] of a stick
・いつでも力になってあげます.　I'm always ready to help you. ｜ I'm there whenever you need me.
・困ったときはお互いに力になりましょう.　Let's help each other out if we are ever in trouble.
►力を借りる　ask for sb's help; enlist the ┏help [aid] 《of…》
・人の力を借りずにやる　do sth ┏by oneself [without anyone's help]
・力を借りに行く　go to sb for help
・人の力を当てにする　count on [*figure on] sb (for help); look to sb for help
・力を貸す[添える]　help; aid; support; give assistance [aid] to…; lend sb a helping hand; use one's influence 《to…》.

・力と頼む佐藤君に去られて手足をもがれたも同然だ.　I had counted on Mr. Satō and now that he has gone I am completely helpless.

►力を養う[つける]　acquire the ┏power of [ability to do]…; cultivate the faculty of…

・力及ばず申し訳ありません.　I am sorry but it was too difficult for me. ｜ I am sorry but it was beyond my ability.

►全世界に散らばっていく　〔人が〕 disperse [scatter] across the globe; go ┏to all parts of the world [all over the world]
・あたり一面に散らばる　〔ガラスの破片などが〕 be [get] scattered ┏everywhere [all over the place].
►部屋には紙くずが散らばっていた.　Scraps of paper lay scattered about the room. ｜ There were scraps of paper all over the room.
・テーブルの上には新聞や雑誌, 手紙などが散らばっていた.　There were newspapers, magazines, letters and so on (strewn) all over the table.
・飛行機の残骸が広い範囲にわたって散らばっていた.　Airplane wreckage was ┏strewn [scattered, dispersed] over a wide area.
・同期の卒業生も今では方々に散らばっている.　The graduates of our class are now widely scattered.
・この辺りの海には数々の島が散らばっている.　There are a number of islands scattered around the sea in this area.

ちらちら [ローマ字](chirachira)
1 〔飛んだり散ったりするようす〕
►雪がちらちら降っている.　It is snowing lightly. ｜ Snowflakes are ┏falling lightly [fluttering about].
・紙吹雪がちらちら舞った.　Clouds of confetti fluttered ┏down [about].
►桜の花が風にちらちら散っている.　Cherry blossoms are ┏fluttering about [being scattered] in the breeze.
2 〔光が点滅して見えるようす〕
►木の葉の間からちらちら光がさしていた.　Light ┏gleamed [flickered, shone fitfully] through the leaves.
・遠くにちらちら見えるのはイカ釣り舟の灯りだ.　What you see flickering in the distance is [Those flickering lights in the distance are] the lights of squid-fishermen's boats.
3 〔見え隠れするようす〕
►雲の切れ目から町の灯りがちらちら見えた.　Through gaps in the clouds the lights of the town ┏came and went [appeared and disappeared]. ｜ I got glimpses of the lights of towns through gaps in the clouds.
4 〔時々視線を向けるようす〕
►ちらちら見る　glance 《at [toward]…, in sb's direction》; cast glances at…; glance now and then at….
5 〔時折聞こえてくるようす〕
►彼女のうわさがちらちら耳に入る.　I hear scraps of news about her from time to time. ｜ There are intermittent rumors about her.

ちらちらする [ローマ字](chirachirasuru)
1 〔明滅する〕 flicker; shimmer; blink.
►テレビの画面がちらちらするした.　The television screen flickered.
・電池がなくなりかけて懐中電灯がちらちらするし始めた.　The torch started flickering as the battery ran low.
・ちらちらする灯り　a flicker (of light); a flickering light; a blink of light.
2 〔見え隠れする〕 appear and disappear.
3 〔目に浮かぶ〕 come to mind; appear.
►死んだ子の姿が目の前にちらちらする　the image of one's dead child comes to the mind's eye; be haunted by the ┏image [memories] of one's dead child.
4 〔まぶしい〕 be ┏dazzled [dazed].
►目がちらちらする.　I'm [My eyes are] dazzled. ｜ The light is dazzling me.

ちらほら [ローマ字](chirahora)
〔ところどころに〕 here and there; by [in] twos and threes; 〔まばらに〕 sporadically; sparsely; thinly; 〔ときどき〕 sporadically; now and then.
►桜がちらほら咲き始めた.　The cherry blossoms have started coming out here and there.
・会場には着物姿の女性もちらほら見えた.　Here and there in the hall you could see a few women in kimonos, too.
・2 人の噂がちらほら聞こえてくる.　You hear rumors about the two of them from time to time. ｜ There are sporadic rumors about the two of them.

ちらかる【散らかる】 [ローマ字](chirakaru)
〔散乱する〕 get [be, lie] scattered about; get strewn around.
►散らかっている　〔部屋などが〕 be in a mess; be untidy; 〔物が〕 be strewn around; be all over the place; lie around (everywhere).
►部屋に紙屑がいっぱい散らかっている.　There are bits of paper ┏lying [scattered, strewn] around all over the room. ｜ The room is littered with scraps of paper.｜ The room is in a mess, with paper everywhere.
・玄関が散らかっている.　The porch is ┏in a mess [untidy].
・散らかっていた方が落ち着くんだ.　I feel more relaxed with things in a mess. ｜ I can't settle down in a tidy room.
・〔訪問客に〕 散らかっておりますが, どうぞお上がりください.　I'm afraid ┏it's very messy [there's a mess, things are untidy], but please come in.

ちらかす【散らかす】 [ローマ字](chirakasu)
〔散乱させる〕 scatter 《things》 (about); mess up 《a room》; make 《a room》 untidy; leave 《things》 lying about; leave 《a house》 in chaos; make [cause] chaos; 〔乱雑に広げる〕 scatter 《litter》; spread 《confusion, a mess》; widen 《confusion, a mess》; throw 《things》 around.
►カラスがごみを散らかす　crows ┏scatter garbage [strew garbage around]
・部屋に紙屑やら空き缶やらを散らかす　mess up a room with bits of paper and empty cans; strew paper and empty cans all over the room.
►夫はいつも部屋じゅうに衣類を散らかしておく.　My husband always leaves his clothes ┏lying about [scattered around, all over] the room.
・大工道具が床に散らかしてあった.　There were carpentry tools ┏(lying) all over [strewn around] the floor.
・部屋は散らかし放題だ.　The room has been left in ┏a terrible mess [complete chaos]. ｜ Things have been left lying all over the room.
・よくこんなに散らかせるな.　I don't know how you can ┏leave things in such a mess [stand the mess]!
・子供が小さいので散らかしております.　I have small children, so the place's a mess.

・食べ散らかす　⇒たべちらかす

ちょうし８【調子】 [ローマ字](chōshi)
1 〔音調〕 a tune; a tone; a key; a note; (高低の) a pitch; 〔拍子〕 time; rhythm.
►調子が合っている[いない]　be ┏in [out of] tune 《with…》
・調子が合う[外れる]　get ┏in [out of] tune
・彼女の声は調子が高い.　Her voice is in a high key.
・このピアノは調子が狂っている.　This piano is out of tune.
►高い調子で　at a high pitch
・低い調子で　in an undertone; in a ┏low [subdued] tone.
►調子の高い[低い]　high-[low-]pitched
・調子の高い声　a shrill note; a high-pitched voice
・調子の合わない　dissonant; discordant; off(-key); out of tune [⇒ちょうしはずれ]
・調子のよい　harmonious; melodious; rhythmical; musical 《voice》.
►調子を取る　〔指などで〕 beat time; 〔足踏みして〕 mark time; 〔ステップで〕 walk to a beat
・調子を外す　strike a false note; sing out of tune
・調子を合わせて　to the accompaniment 《of the music》
・調子をそろえて歌う　sing in tune.
►その歌はこんな調子だ.　The song goes like this.
2 〔語調〕 a tone; a strain; a note; (抑揚) an accent; values; 〔言葉の言い回し〕 a vein; a tone; 〔様子〕 a vein; a mood.
►高い調子で話す　speak in a high-pitched voice; 〔格調高く〕 speak in a lofty strain
・強い[きつい]調子で言う　say in a peremptory tone
・激しい調子で反対意見を述べる　voice one's opposition most ┏vehemently [forcefully]
・ふざけた調子で話しかける　speak to sb in a jocular tone
・自分に言い聞かせるような調子で言う　speak as if to oneself
・新聞は皆大体同じ調子で論じている.　All the papers speak more or less in the same strain.
►調子を下げる　lower the ┏pitch [tone]; 〔新聞などが〕 lower the tone; play down 《to the public》
・大衆向きに調子を下げて[落として]書く　write down to the public
・聴衆にわかるように講演の調子を落とす　lower the tone of one's lecture to the level of [talk down to] the audience
・調子を変える　〔声の〕 modulate; 〔言葉の〕 change one's ┏tone [tune, note]
・調子を変えて　in another strain; in a changed tone
・彼は小言をいっていたが急にその調子を変えた.　He was complaining and then suddenly changed his tune.
・声の調子を和らげる　soften one's tone
・声の調子を乱す　speak in an agitated tone of voice
・翻訳で原文の調子を伝えるのは難しい.　It is difficult to convey in a translation the tone of the original.
3 〔やり方〕 a way; a manner; a style; 〔こつ〕 a knack; a hang.
►こういう調子で　in this ┏way [manner]
・こういう調子でやってください.　Please do it this way.
・彼はだれに対しても同じような調子で接する.　He acts the same way toward everyone.
►調子を飲み込む　get the hang 《of…》; get [acquire] the knack 《of…》.
►その調子, その調子!　That's it. ｜ That's the way. ｜ Keep it up. ｜ That's more like it.
・田舎では万事がこの調子だ.　This is the way things go in the country.
・この人, いつもこんな調子なんですよ.　This is the way he always is.
4 〔具合・状態〕 a condition; a state (of health); order.
►調子は上々である　〔体の〕 be in the best of health; be in ┏excellent [perfect] health; 《口》 be in the pink.
►体の調子がいい　be [feel] well; be in good condition; 〔運動選手などが〕 be in fine shape; be in ┏training [form, trim]
・調子が悪い　〔体の〕 be [feel] unwell; be out of ┏condition [sorts, form]; be in bad shape; 〔機械などの〕 be out of ┏order [trim, gear]; something is wrong 《with…》; be out of ┏kilter [whack]
・今日は体の調子がよくない.　I am not up to ┏the mark [snuff] today.
・今日は一日エンジンの調子がよかった.　The engine ran great all day today.
・プリンターの調子が悪い.　The printer is out of whack. ｜ Something is wrong with the printer.
・機械の調子がおかしい.　The machine is not working properly.
・あれからすべての調子が狂い始めた.　From that point on, everything began to go out of kilter.
・そんなこと言われると調子狂っちゃうなあ.　Being told something like that messes things up for me.
・突然の笑い声に(演説の)調子が狂ってしまった.　The speaker was thrown off stride by the sudden laughter.
・彼は少し調子が変だよ.　Something is a bit wrong with him. ｜ He's not his usual self.
・この運動をするとお腹の調子がよくなります.　This exercise will tone up your stomach.
►この調子では　at this rate; if things go (on) like this
・そんな調子でやっていてはだめだ.　It won't work if you do it like that.
・この調子では今月中にはできあがるまい.　At this rate it will not be finished this month.
・あんな調子では大したものにはなれないだろう.　If he keeps on like that, he will never amount to much.
・こんな調子で 1 年が過ぎていった.　Things went on like this as a year passed.
►体の調子を整える　tone up one's body; get in ┏good [proper] trim [shape]
・調子を取り戻す　〔選手が〕 regain one's form
・調子を落とす[崩す]　〔選手が〕 fall out of shape; lose one's form
・調子を崩さないようにする　〔選手が〕 keep in ┏training [form, trim]
・調子を取り戻させる　〔選手の〕 get sb back into shape.
►調子はいかがですか.　〔物事などの〕 How are things (going)?
・万事調子よく行った.　Everything went ┏all right [well].
5 〔勢い〕 strain; 〔はずみ〕 impetus; spur 《of the moment》.
►調子が出る　warm up 《to one's work》; get into the swing of 《one's work》; hit [get into] one's stride
・やっと調子が出てきた.　〔運動選手などが〕 I finally got into my rhythm.
・今日はいつもの調子が出なかった.　〔選手などが〕 He wasn't ┏in the best of form [up to the mark] today.
・そのトーナメントでは日本選手はついに最後まで調子が出なかった.　The Japanese players finally ended up playing poorly during the whole of that tournament.
6 【相場】 a tone; a trend.
►健全な[手堅い]調子を示す[保持する]　〔市場が〕 display [maintain] a ┏healthy [steady] tone.
調子がいい　glib; superficially fluent.
►調子がいいやつ　a ┏glib [thoughtless] person; a timeserver
・調子がいいことばかり言う　say (only) what one thinks ┏will please one's listener(s) [one's listener(s) want(s) to hear].
調子に乗る　〔得意になる・いい気になる〕 be [get] elated ┏by [with]…; 〔はしゃぐ〕 get carried away.
►調子に乗ってしゃべる　talk without ┏reserve [restraint]
・つい調子に乗ってよけいなことまで言ってしまった.　In the end, I got carried away and said too much.
調子を合わせる　attune oneself 《to…》; make oneself agreeable to sb; play in sb's key; keep in tune 《with…》; chime in with others; 《口》 keep in with sb; 〔楽器の〕 tune 《a piano》; put 《a piano》 in tune; 〔演芸などで相手に〕 play up to sb.
►彼はだれとでもうまく調子を合わせていく.　He gets on ┏well [nicely] with others.
・オーケストラは調子を合わせているところだった.　The orchestra was tuning up.
◨上[下]調子　an upward [a downward] trend.
標準調子　【音楽】 the standard pitch.
◧調子記号　【音楽】 a key signature.
調子笛　a pitch pipe.

1 〔留意・注目〕 attention; observation; note; notice; heed; interest; advertence; advertency; 〔警戒・用心〕 care; watch; guard; caution; precaution.
〜する 〔心に留める〕 pay [give] attention [heed] to…; observe; take ┏note [notice] of…; attend to…; give ear to…; heed; mind; mark; take care of…; be ┏careful [mindful] of…; 〔用心する〕 beware of…; be ┏cautious [watchful] of…; observe [exercise] precautions; guard against…; look out for…; watch; keep watch.
►注意の上にも注意する　take every possible care; take the ┏utmost [greatest] care
・注意して, 注意深く　attentively; with ┏attention [care, caution]; observantly; carefully; cautiously; discreetly; scrupulously; sedulously; 【海】 (ゆっくりと) handsomely
・注意して聞く　listen to…attentively; give [lend] an ear to…
・注意して機会をうかがう　be on the lookout for a chance
・健康に注意する　take care of ┏oneself [one's health]
・交通信号に注意する　pay attention to traffic signals
・合図に注意する　〔目で見て〕 watch for ┏signals [a signal]; 〔耳で聞いて〕 listen for ┏signals [a signal]
・食物に注意する　be careful about what one eats
・十分注意する　pay great ┏care [attention] 《to…》; take great care
・火の元に注意する　be careful with fire
・注意すべき点　points to be paid attention to; hints
・私の言うことを注意して聞いてください.　Please pay close attention to what I tell you.
・彼女は非常に注意して聞いていた.　She was all ┏ears [attention].
・以後注意します.　I will be more careful in the future.
・風邪を引かないように注意してね.　Be careful (that) you do not catch cold.
・子供たちにけがのないように注意してください.　Be careful [Take care] that the children do not get hurt.
・間違えないようによく注意しなさい.　Take every precaution against error.
・この家は採光に注意して建ててある.　This house is built with ┏close attention [a view] to lighting.
►細心の[行き届いた]注意　scrupulous [religious] care.
►注意深い　careful; heedful; observant; mindful; attentive; 〔用心深い〕 careful; cautious; wary; watchful; discreet
・注意深く観察する　observe ┏carefully [meticulously].
►注意が行き届く　be careful enough; take every possible precaution
・万事注意が行き届いている.　Everything is well attended to.
・あの学校は生徒に対する注意が実によく行き届いている.　The school is extremely attentive to its students.
・今度の失敗はすべて私の注意が行き届かなかったからです.　This error is all due to my lack of ┏care [attention].
・注意が足りない　be ┏careless [inattentive, incautious]
・それは注意が足りないからだ.　That is due to your carelessness.
►注意を払う　pay attention 《to…》; keep close watch 《on…》
・注意を引く　draw [attract, catch, arrest, engage, occupy, command] sb's attention; turn sb's head(s)
・人の注意を引くような　〔魅力的な〕 attractive; winning; engaging; 〔本などが〕 catchy
・注意を喚起する　excite [draw] attention
・注意を向ける　turn [direct] one's attention to…
・注意を怠る　be ┏careless [negligent]; fail to take necessary precautions; relax ┏attention [precautions]
・注意を集中する　concentrate [focus, center] attention 《on…》
・注意をそらす　divert [distract, take] one's attention 《from…》
・注意を促す　call [invite] sb's attention 《to…》; bring 《a matter》 to sb's attention
・注意を呼びかける　bring 《a matter》 to public attention; call on people to pay attention
・この問題の取扱い方には細心の注意を要する.　We must exercise discretion [The greatest care must be taken] in dealing with the matter.
・特にこのことにご注意を願いたい.　I'd like to call your special attention to this fact.
・そのことにもっと注意を払うべきだった.　It deserved more attention than it received.
►落石注意.　〔山道の標識などで〕 Beware of falling rocks.
・頭上注意.　〔工事現場の看板などで〕 Caution overhead.
・模造品あり, 登録商標にご注意ください.　〔商品広告で〕 Watch for our trademark; avoid [beware of] imitations.
・取り扱い注意.　〔荷物などの表示で〕 Handle with care.
・足もとにご注意ください.　Watch [Mind] your step.
2 〔忠告〕 (a piece of) advice; counsel; 〔警告〕 (a) warning; a caveat; 〔示唆〕 (a) suggestion; 〔説諭〕 (an) admonition; 〔心得〕 rules; hints; instructions.
〜する 〔忠告する〕 advise; counsel; give advice to…; 〔警告する〕 warn; forewarn; give warning; caution sb against…; 〔説諭する〕 admonish sb; 〔思い出させる〕 remind sb of…; make sb think of….

・厳重に注意する　strongly admonish

►衛生上の注意　advice about hygiene

►注意を与える　give sb advice; 〔警告する〕 give sb (a) warning

・大事なことから先にやれ.　Start with the important things. ｜ Put first things first.

►大事にしまっておく　treasure (up); keep in a safe place; 〔鍵のかかる所に〕 keep sth under lock and key

だいじょうぶ【大丈夫】 [ローマ字](daijōbu)
1 〜な 〔安心な〕 free from care; without fear; 〔安全な〕 safe; secure; free from danger; proof; 〔確実な〕 all right; alright; OK; problem-free; fine; satisfactory; sure; sound.

►〔具合の悪そうな人に〕 「大丈夫ですか?」「ええ, 大丈夫です」　"Are you all right?"―"Yes, I'm ┏all right [OK], thank you."
・(追突)事故で首を少しやられたが, あとは大丈夫だった.　My neck got slightly hurt in the accident but ┏there's nothing else wrong with me [the rest of me is OK].
・ここまで逃げればもう大丈夫だ.　Now we've come this far we are ┏safe [all right, OK, out of danger]. ｜ It's safe [There's no danger] this far (away).
・「自分だけは大丈夫」という考えが交通事故のもとだ.　The "it-can't-happen-to-me attitude" is what causes accidents.
・この分なら明日の遠足は大丈夫だろう.　If it's like this, tomorrow's outing should be OK. ｜ It looks ┏OK [safe] for tomorrow's outing.
・彼女になら何を打ち明けても大丈夫だ.　You can safely [It's safe to] tell anything to her.
・カードさえあれば旅行は大丈夫.　As long as you have a credit card you'll be all right when traveling. ｜ It's safe to travel [There's no problem traveling] provided you have a credit card.
・その点は大丈夫です.　There's no need to worry [You can relax] about that.
・この水は飲んでも大丈夫ですか.　Is this water ┏safe [OK] (to drink)?
・この件は彼に任せておけば大丈夫だ.　It'll be safe in his hands. ｜ If you leave it to him it'll ┏be OK [go all right].
・よし, これで大丈夫.　〔戸締まりなどをして〕 Right [Fine, Good]. Now everything's ┏OK [safe]. ｜ 〔処置などを終えて〕 Fine [Right, Good]. Now everything's all right. [There's nothing more to worry about].
・戸締まりは大丈夫?　Are all the doors and windows locked? ｜ Are the doors and windows securely fastened? ｜ Have you checked all the doors and windows?
・「盗まれないだろうか」「大丈夫だよ」　"Won't it get stolen?"―"No, it'll be ┏OK [fine, perfectly safe]."
・彼女ならどの職場でも大丈夫だ.　〔勤まる〕 She'll ┏be all right [do fine] in any job.

2 〔確実に; 確かに〕 certainly; definitely; surely; infallibly; assuredly; undoubtedly; (念を押して) You can depend (up)on it that…; I assure you (that…); I promise you (that…).

・「借金の話ならお断りだよ」「まあ聞くだけ聞いてくれ」　"If it's a loan you want, the answer's no."―"Come on, at least listen to what I have to say."
・迷惑をかけるだけかけておいて挨拶なしとは不届き千万.　That's outrageous, not to say sorry after putting us to all that trouble.
…だけある
►いばるだけある.　He's all he boasts himself to be.
…だけあって　⇒-だけあって.
…だけ(でも)ましだ[いい]
►シャワーは水だったが, 水が出るだけまだましだった.　The shower was cold, but at least the water was running.
・ボーナスが出るだけでもましだ.　At least we still get a bonus.
・火事は災難だったが死者が出なかっただけでもよかった.　The fire was a tragedy, but at least no one was killed.
…だけに　⇒-だけに.
…だけのことはある
►さすが名人だけのことはある.　They don't call him the master for nothing.
・さすが自慢するだけのことはある.　She's quite right to be proud.
・はるばる来ただけのことはある. すばらしい景色だ.　It was worth coming all that way. It's a wonderful view.
・そんなに喜んでくれるなら苦心しただけのことはあった.　It was worth all the trouble, if it makes you so happy.
・忍耐[努力]すれば必ず忍耐[努力]しただけのことはある.　Perseverance [Effort] is always repaid.
…だけのこと[話]だ
►検査といってもちょっと写真を撮るだけのことですからね.　It's called a test, but all it means is taking a few photographs.
・彼の言う国際化とは, ただ海外旅行をしろというだけの話[こと]だ.　What he calls globalization boils down to (no more than) a proposal to travel abroad.
・失敗したらその時は辞めるだけの話[こと]だ.　If it fails, then I'll quit, that's all.
…ば…だけ, …すれば…するだけ　in proportion as…; according as….
►文明が進めば進むだけ　(in proportion) as civilization advances
・話し合えば話し合うだけ溝は深まるばかりだった.　The more we talked, the wider the gulf opened between us.
・うちの犬はやればやっただけ食べてしまう.　Our dog will eat as much as you give it.

・さぞ空腹だっただろう.　You must have been very hungry.
・「あいつ, 連絡してくるだろうな」「うん, 大丈夫だろう」　"I hope he'll get in touch."―"Oh, I'm sure he will."
・彼はなぜ来なかったのだろうか.　I wonder why he didn't come.
・だれがそんなところへ行きたがるだろうか.　Who would want to go to a place like that?
・そうすれば, うまく行ったのだろうが.　If she had done that, she ┏would [might] have succeeded.
・一人で食べてもおいしくないだろうに.　But it can't be very pleasant eating alone.
2 〔念押しや同意を求める意を表す〕 right?; is(n't) that so?
►君はそのことを知ってるだろう?　You know that, don't you?
・あそこに本屋があるだろう?　There's a bookshop over there, see?
・目の前にあるだろう.　It's right under your nose! See?
・おまえがそう言ったんだろうが.　But it was you who said it!
・だから言っただろう.　I told you so. ｜ I told you, didn't I?
・「あの映画おもしろかったよ」「だろう?」　"That was a good movie."―"See? I told you (it would be)."
・「彼はまた失敗したってさ」「そうだろうね」　"It seems he messed things up again."―"Quite likely."
・そんなこと言ったってしかたないだろう.　It's no use saying things like that, is it?
・ちゃんとかぎをかけてきただろうね.　You did lock up properly, didn't you?

・ジェット機のパイロットになるにはどうすればいいのかと聞かれた.　Someone asked me how one goes about learning to be a jet pilot.
・落第したらどうする.　What (would you do) if you should fail?
・もし木村にデートに誘われたらどうする?　What would you ┏say [do] if Kimura asked you for a date?
・「うまく行くだろうか」「さあ, どうかな」　"Will it work?"―"Well, ┏I don't know [I'm not sure]."
・この間私に見せてくれた時計はどうしたの.　What ┏happened to [did you do with] the watch you showed me the other day?
・このいたずら小僧め! どうしてくれよう.　You little rascal! What shall I do with you?
・その後どうしていましたか.　What have you been doing (with yourself) since we met? ｜ How have you been occupying yourself?
・「食べる物はどうしたんですか」「缶詰をたくさん持って行ったんです」　"What did you do for food?"―"I took a lot of canned goods along."
・君は私にどうしろと言うのだ.　What is it you want me to do?｜ What do you expect me to do?
・〔それでも不満そうな相手に〕 ではどうすればいいんですか.　What else ┏am I supposed [do you want me] to do then?
・その後, 君の仕事はどうなっているかね.　How are you coming along with your work?
・(事態が)どうなるかと心配した.　I was anxious about how the matter would turn out.
・世の中は一体どうなってしまうのだろう.　I don't know what ┏the world is [things are] coming to.
・そうなったら僕らはどうなるんだろう.　Then where ┏are we [shall we be]? ｜ What will become of us then?
・どこでどう間違ったのかこんなことになってしまった.　I don't know what went wrong that things should have turned out this way.
・どうだか怪しい.　There's something fishy about it.
・彼はああ言っているがどうだかね.　I hesitate to take him at his word.
・んー, どうしようかなあ.　〔誘われて〕 (迷っているとき) Mm…, what should I do. ｜ (断りたいとき) Mm…, ┏I'll [let me] think about it.
4 〔安否などを気遣う〕
►どうした? 顔色が悪いぞ.　What's the matter (with you)? You look pale.
・どうなることかとはらはらしながら(二人のけんかを)見つめていた.　We watched (their quarrel) ┏on tenterhooks [holding our breath], wondering what was going to happen.
・どうなることかと思った.　I was worried about how things would turn out. ｜ I wondered how it all might end.
・彼はどうしたのだろう.　What can have become of him? ｜ I wonder what has become of him?
・あの人はどうしているのかしら.　I wonder how she is ┏getting along [making out].
・どうしたの.　What's the matter? ｜ What's wrong?
・その脚, どうしたの?　What happened to your leg?
・〔医者が患者に〕 どうなさいましたか.　What seems to be the trouble?
5 〔どのようであるかを特定しないで言う〕
►どうあっても, どうあろうと　whatever ┏happens [may happen]; at any ┏price [cost]; at all events; on any terms; under any circumstances; cost what it may; for all the world; 〔否定〕 in no circumstances; on no account; in no event; upon no condition
・どう考えてみても　by any stretch of the imagination; whichever way you look at it
・どう考えてみてもそれはおかしいよ.　No matter how you look at it that's ┏strange [ridiculous].
・どうもならん, どうしようもない.　There's nothing for it. ｜ It's hopeless. ｜ There is no help for it. ｜ Nothing can be done about it. ｜ There is no way out of it.
・私はどうすることもできなかった.　I was quite ┏helpless [powerless]. ｜ There was ┏not a thing [nothing] I could do.
・私一人が頑張ったところでどうなるものでもない.　My efforts alone ┏don't add up to much [will make little difference].
・結果についてはどうとも言えない.　I can't say how it will turn out. ｜ I am not ┏certain [sure] what the result will be.
・どうって別に知恵を持ち合わせているわけじゃないけど.　It's not that I've got any particularly good plan in mind.
・どうするか見てやがれ.　You will pay for this. ｜ This isn't the end of this!
・どうとでも好きにしろ.　Do whatever you want. ｜ Do as you please!
・こんな寒さどうってことないさ.　This cold is nothing. ｜ This degree of cold isn't worth making a fuss about.
・水道や電気のない生活も慣れればどうってことなかった.　Once you get used to living without piped water and electricity, there's nothing to it.

►あなたどこの生まれなの.　Where were you born?

・どこへ行っても　wherever you (may) go; no matter where you (may) go
・どこへなりともお供します.　Wherever you go I'll go.
・どこへ行くという当てもなく, どこへともなく　uncertain where to go; without any definite destination in mind; aimlessly
・どこへともなく逃げ去る　run off ┏nobody knows where [God knows where]

・さっきまでのかしこまった様子はどこへやらで, 今はずいぶんと羽目をはずしている.　Where have gone his quiet ways; he's certainly letting go.

・どんなことでも　anything; everything; 〔否定の場合〕 nothing
・どんなことをしても　at all costs [at any cost]; by any means
・どんなことをされても　however ┏hard [ill] one is treated; no matter what ┏befalls [is done to] one
・どんなことがあっても　whatever may happen; no matter what; 〔いかなる事情の下でも〕 under [in] any circumstances; 《俗》 come hell or high water; 〔決して(…しない)〕 《not》 for all the world; 《not》 for anything; on no account; under no condition.
►どんなささいなことでも結構ですから気づかれたことをおっしゃってください.　Please tell me anything you may have noticed, no matter how small.

・どんなことがあろうと私は彼のそばを離れない.　I'll stay by his side through thick and thin.
・君のためならどんなことでもする.　For you, I'll do anything. ｜ I would give my right arm for your sake.
・金さえあればどんなことでもできる.　As long as you have money you can do anything.
・そこに行けばどんなものでも買える.　You can buy anything there.
・どんなものでも骨を折らずに得られるものは得る価値がない.　Nothing is worth getting if you can get it without labor.
・どんな言葉でも瞬時に翻訳してくれる機械がほしい.　I want a machine that will instantaneously translate any language there is.

►大いに影響する　have [exert] a ┏great [far-reaching] influence on…; produce a powerful effect on…; impact heavily on…; impact sth heavily
・子供の成育には環境が大いに影響する.　Environment has a great ┏influence [impact] on a child's development.
・互いに影響し合う　have a mutual influence on each other; mutually impact
・利害関係に影響する　affect one's interests
・年齢は記憶力に影響する.　Age affects memory.
►影響が大きい[少ない]　have ┏a great [only a slight] influence 《on …》.
►…の影響で　under the ┏influence [impact] of…; owing to…; in consequence of…; as a result of…
・あの会社は不況の影響で倒産した.　That company folded as a consequence of the recession.
・私は兄の影響でロックが好きになった.　It was through my older brother's influence that I was attracted to rock music.
►うちの子が不良になったのは周りの影響によるものだ.　The influence of those around him is what led to our child's delinquency.
・外界からの影響に動かされやすい　be susceptible to outside influences
・その会社は円安の及ぼす影響に対応できる態勢を整えた.　That company completed arrangements to enable it to cope with the effects of a weak yen.
►…の影響を受ける　be ┏affected [influenced] by…; be subject to the influence of…
・生徒は教師の影響を受けやすい.　School children are easily influenced by their teachers.
・出版事業は大いに不況の影響を受けた.　The publishing business was very ┏hard hit [seriously affected] by the recession.
・よい影響を及ぼす[与える]　have [exert, exercise] a favorable influence upon…; have [produce] a good effect ┏on [upon]…; impact favorably on…; impact sth favorably
・悪い影響を及ぼす[与える]　exert a ┏bad [harmful, baneful, vicious] influence upon…; have [produce] a ┏bad [harmful] effect on…; affect adversely; impact adversely on…; impact sth adversely
・…にマイナスの影響を与える　have an adverse effect on…; adversely affect…
・それは彼の計画にどういう影響を及ぼしますか.　How does it ┏affect [impact (on)] his plan?
・影響を及ぼさない[与えない]　have no ┏effect [impact] on…; do not impact on…
・この事件が彼の全生涯に影響を及ぼした.　This event ┏colored [impacted (on), influenced, affected] his entire life.
►第二次大戦の影響は今もなお至るところに感じられる.　The repercussions of the Second World War are still felt everywhere.
・冷戦終結の影響は新しいさまざまな問題を生み出した.　The results of the end of the Cold War have spawned a variety of new problems.
・アジア経済破綻の影響から, 世界中の市場が混乱を来した.　Markets all over the world were thrown into disarray as a result of the Asian economic breakdown.

►あの社長は身内をえこひいきしている.　That company president ┏favors his own relations [gives better jobs to members of his own family].

・あの先生はえこひいきがひどい.　That teacher is terribly partial (to some students). ｜ That teacher has favorites, which isn't fair.
►教師はえこひいきのない指導をすべきだ.　A teacher should always teach ┏without any favoritism [impartially].
►彼は生徒のだれにもえこひいきをしない.　He has no favorites among his students. ｜ He does not show any favoritism towards any of his pupils.
►あの転校生に対する君のやり方はえこひいきだ.　The way you treat that new pupil is favoritism.
・田中先生はえこひいきなく生徒に接している.　Mr. Tanaka treats his students without any favoritism. ｜ Mr. Tanaka treats all his students ┏equally [fairly].

・金にはとんと縁がない.　I'm not fated to make money. ｜ Money and I are strangers. ｜ I never have any luck with money.
・私は虫歯には縁がない.　I never suffer from bad teeth. ｜ I've always been lucky with my teeth.
・この病気とはなかなか縁が切れない.　This illness just won't leave me alone. ｜ I can't shake off this illness.
►不思議な縁で　by ┏an unusual [a curious] turn of fate; by (a) ┏happy [fortunate] chance
・彼とは飛行機で隣り合わせたのが縁で親しくなった.　He happened to sit next to me on a plane, and we became friends.
・ボランティア活動が取り結んだ縁で彼らは結婚した.　They got married through their volunteer work.
・彼女とは母校につらなる縁で今も交流がある.　She and I were at school together and have kept in touch ever since.
・私たちは切っても切れない縁で結ばれている.　There is a bond between us that we cannot untie. ｜ There will always be a bond between us.
►縁に引かされて　drawn together by ┏fate [destiny]
・これをご縁にこれからもお目にかかりたいものです.　I hope to see more of you. ｜ I hope this is only the first of many chances for us to meet.
・私は徳川家の縁につながる者だ.　I am ┏related to [connected with] the Tokugawa ┏family [line].
►土地を買うなんて私には縁のない話だ.　I'm afraid purchase of a plot of land is something that's not in the stars for me.
・近ごろは読書とは縁のない生活をしている.　The way I've been living recently, I don't have any time for reading.
・ここは織田家と縁の深い土地だ.　This area has strong associations with the Oda family.
・金の切れ目が縁の切れ目.　⇒かね１ 2
・縁の遠い親類　a distant ┏relation [relative]; a remote kinsman. [⇒とおえん]
►縁を結ぶ　〔夫婦の〕 arrange [contract] a marriage; marry; get married; 《口》 tie the knot; (婚約する) promise to marry; 〔養子縁組で親子の〕 form an adoptive relationship; 〔義兄弟の〕 swear eternal brotherhood
・私はこの町と浅からぬ縁を持っています.　I have close ties to this town.
・当社が創業以来 10 年で 100 社を超えるお客様とご縁を持つことができましたのは, ひとえに皆様方のご厚情と感謝いたしております.　We are grateful to all of you for your great kindness, which has enabled us to ┏establish relations [build ties, make connections] with over 100 companies in the 10 years years since our founding.
・昔の縁を頼りにその男を訪ねてみた.　I visited him, on the basis of our old ┏relationship [acquaintance].
・縁を断つ　break off [sever] relations 《with…》
・夫婦の縁を断つ　divorce; get divorced
・夫との縁を切る　divorce [get divorced from, finish with] one's husband
・親子[兄弟]の縁を切る　disown sb as a ┏son [brother]
・あの会社とは早く縁を切ったほうがよい.　It would be better to sever your relations with that company as soon as possible. ｜ Break it off with that company as soon as you can.
►縁あって二人は夫婦になった.　They were meant for each other. ｜ Theirs was a marriage made in heaven.
・われわれと地震との縁は切っても切れない.　Earthquakes in our lives are part of our destiny. ｜ We Japanese can never ┏separate [sever] ourselves from earthquakes.
・私は政界とは縁もゆかりもない.　I have ┏no connection whatever [nothing whatever to do] with politics. ｜ Politics is completely ┏foreign [alien] to me. ｜ I am an utter stranger to politics.
・彼女は私には縁もゆかりもない人物だ.　She is a perfect stranger to me. ｜ There is nothing at all (to do) between her and me.
・私はあの男とは縁もゆかりもない.　That man is nothing whatever to do with me.
・縁なき衆生(しゅじょう)は度し難し.　A lost soul is beyond redemption.
・縁は異なもの味なもの.　Inscrutable and interesting are the ways two people are brought together in wedlock.
・縁と月日の末を待て.＝縁と浮世は末を待て.　Bide your time and wait, for a good marriage and for a good opportunity. 【諺】

►3 メートル延長する　make sth three meters longer; extend by three meters
・直線 AB を 2 倍に延長する　double the length of line AB; extend line AB to twice its length
・10 分延長する　extend 《TV coverage, a talk, a program》 ten minutes
・無期限に延長する　extend indefinitely
・会期を延長する　extend a ┏session [sitting]
・〔契約期限など〕 延長できる　extendable [renewable] 《lease》
・この試合中継は放送時間を延長してお送りします.　Live coverage of this game will be extended (beyond the scheduled time).
・本線は東京まで延長された.　This (subway, train) line has been extended to Tokyo.
・滑走路が延長された.　The runway has been extended.
►試合は延長13 回で決着がついた.　〔野球で〕 The game went four extra innings before being decided.
2 〔合計した長さ〕 length; extent.
►この市のバス路線は延長 200 キロほどだ.　Bus lines in this city are up to two hundred kilometers long.
3 〔ひと続きのもの〕 an extension.
►その講演は大学の講義の延長みたいなものだった.　That lecture was a sort of extension of a university lecture.
・君の趣味は仕事の延長だな.　Your hobby seems to be an extension of your work.
◨総延長　overall [total] length.
◧延長記号　【音楽】 ＝フェルマータ.
延長区間　〔鉄道などの〕 an extended section.
延長工事　extension work; extension.
